Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (partly worn) with ghosts of two added white bands; reserved interior and edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '354' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Heavy chalices and chalice kraters are found in the Chian Mature Animal Style and Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0644) (phase 2)
